appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Electoral Campaigning Transparency
appg_groups.purpose: To evaluate current UK electoral campaigning laws, interviewing experts and practitioners in the field, producing the evidence base for recommendations that ensure electoral campaigning laws are fit for purpose in the modern era. In reconstitution the APPG's aim is to secure those recommendations in parliament.

appg_groups.name: Electoral Reform
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Electoral Reform
appg_groups.purpose: To build alliances, strengthen parliamentary work towards proportional representation and broader electoral reform in the UK, and develop the evidence base.

appg_groups.name: Electric Vehicles
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Electric Vehicles
appg_groups.purpose: To engage parliamentarians interested in electric vehicles by considering issues relating to manufacturing, energy supply and infrastructure requirements amongst others. The group will also consider the impacts of automated vehicles and other forms of electric mobility by bringing together manufacturers, businesses and experts to promote awareness and debate future policy options.

appg_groups.name: Endometriosis
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Endometriosis
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of endometriosis and investigate how those who suffer from the condition can receive the support they need.

appg_groups.name: Energy Costs
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Energy Costs
appg_groups.purpose: To promote evidence-based discussion on all aspects of energy costs; to inform energy policy decisions and to enable communications between interested parties and relevant parliamentarians.

appg_groups.name: Energy Security
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Energy Security
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the security of energy supply in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Energy Studies
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Energy Studies
appg_groups.purpose: Informing the government of the day of the energy issues of the day.

appg_groups.name: Entrepreneurship
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Entrepreneurship
appg_groups.purpose: To encourage, support and promote entrepreneurship. Also ensures that parliament is kept up to date on what is needed to create and sustain the most favourable conditions for entrepreneurship.

appg_groups.name: the Environment
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Environment
appg_groups.purpose: To strengthen the influence of parliamentarians on public policy and public debate on the environment, and to assist parliamentarians by improving their access to specialist information.

appg_groups.name: Environmental Social and Governance
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Environmental, Social, and Governance
appg_groups.purpose: To act as the forum for business, government, and the consumer to discuss issues of Environmental, Social, and Governance (ES&G) and to drive forward measures which will ensure a sustainable, responsible, and successful UK economy

appg_groups.name: Epilepsy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Epilepsy
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of epilepsy among parliamentarians and to engage with individuals and organisations in supporting the promotion of the needs of the epilepsy community.

appg_groups.name: Equality Diversity and Inclusivity Professionals
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Equality, Diversity and Inclusivity Professionals
appg_groups.purpose: To advance equality, diversity and inclusivity (EDI) in government policy considerations from those in EDI roles. To ensure the knowledge and expertise of EDI professionals is nationally recognised to support improvements in the delivery of services and work relations.

appg_groups.name: Equipment for Disabled Children
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Equipment for Disabled Children
appg_groups.purpose: To remove barriers that prevent disabled and terminally ill children from receiving the right equipment at the right time. Working across parliament and with health and social care professionals, decision makers and families to inform and shine a light on best practice.

appg_groups.name: Esports
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Esports
appg_groups.purpose: To support esports.

appg_groups.name: Ethics and Sustainability in Fashion
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Ethics and Sustainability in Fashion
appg_groups.purpose: To focus on both the ethical and environmental aspects of the fashion

appg_groups.name: Ethnic Minority Business Owners
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Ethnic Minority Business Owners
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together parliamentarians from all parties and both Houses with key players in Black, Asian and Minority Ethnic (BAME) businesses to promote the growth of successful BAME businesses across the UK. A key aim is to promote an inclusive national strategy of policy, support and resources to enable the growth of BAME owned businesses for the benefit of the overall UK economy.

appg_groups.name: Events
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Events
appg_groups.purpose: Cross-party group made up of members from both Houses which acts as a voice in Parliament for the UK’s vital £84 billion world-leading events sector.

appg_groups.name: Explosive Threats
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Explosive Threats
appg_groups.purpose: To consider the humanitarian consequences of explosive weapons and the assistance needed by victims of explosive violence. Through research and inquiry advocate for appropriate policy change, act as a focal point for debate and exchange of ideas, views and information.

appg_groups.name: Extraordinary Rendition
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Extraordinary Rendition
appg_groups.purpose: To examine extraordinary rendition and related issues, in response to allegations of British involvement in the extraordinary rendition programme.

appg_groups.name: Extreme Poverty
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Extreme Poverty
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a focal point in the UK parliament for discussion on extreme poverty. To convene key stakeholders working towards the eradication of extreme poverty. To provide practical recommendations for the UK government to tackle extreme poverty.

appg_groups.name: Eye Health and Visual Impairment
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Eye Health and Visual Impairment
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the interests and concerns of blind and partially sighted people.

appg_groups.name: Fair Business Banking
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Fair Business Banking
appg_groups.purpose: To identify the failings within the financial service sector and work with industry, regulators and businesses to encourage and promote positive proposals for change.

appg_groups.name: Fair Fuel for UK Motorists and UK Hauliers
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Fair Fuel for UK Motorists and UK Hauliers
appg_groups.purpose: To represent major issues that impact on UK drivers, from motorists to hauliers. Notably current fuel taxation, congestion charges, ULEZ/CAZs, parking costs, roads investment, fairer treatment for carbon based fuelled vehicle owners, solutions to lower emissions, cleaner fuel incentives, alternative technology options and transparent pricing at the fuel pumps. The APPG will also formulate a long term approach to the future of road taxation and a positive road transport strategy.

appg_groups.name: Fairtrade
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Fairtrade
appg_groups.purpose: To promote fairtrade within parliament; to deepen the relationship between local fairtrade organisations and parliamentarians and to further raise awareness of the importance of fairtrade.

appg_groups.name: Faith and Society
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Faith and Society
appg_groups.purpose: To highlight the contribution to society by faith-based organisations, to identify best practice, and to promote understanding of the groups providing innovative solutions around the country.

appg_groups.name: Family Business
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Family Business
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and facilitate communication and understanding between the UK family business sector and members of both houses.

appg_groups.name: Farming
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Farming
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG will allow Members to learn more about the world of British Farming. Through engagements and visits to an array of sites across the industry, the APPG will encourage parliamentarians to develop greater understanding and appreciation for the vital role that farming plays to our nation’s health and economy.

appg_groups.name: Fatherhood
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Fatherhood
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG for Fatherhood promotes the wellbeing of children by ensuring that legal and policy frameworks keep up with the changing nature of family life and that legislation encourages active and responsible fatherhood.

appg_groups.name: Film and Broader Screen
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Film and Broader Screen
appg_groups.purpose: To enhance understanding of and promotion of the British film industry, film culture and the wider moving image in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Financial Education for Young People
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Financial Education for Young People
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians and organisations to discuss the current provision of financial education in schools, further education and higher education, and ensure that all young people - regardless of background - are equipped to make informed financial decisions.

appg_groups.name: Financial Markets and Services
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Financial Markets and Services
appg_groups.purpose: To provide parliamentarians with a unique forum for briefings and constructive debate on issues relating to the financial sector with senior city practitioners, advisors, economists and academics.

appg_groups.name: Financial Resilience
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Financial Resilience
appg_groups.purpose: To explore factors impacting people’s financial resilience and wellbeing. The group will investigate financial safety nets, looking in particular at the middle income group, focusing on the policy issues affecting people’s ability to cope with financial shocks in the immediate term, and their future financial preparedness.

appg_groups.name: Financial Technology
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Financial Technology
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a progressive forum for parliamentarians to discuss the challenges and opportunities relating to the growth and competitiveness of the Financial Technology (FinTech) industry.

appg_groups.name: First Do No Harm
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group First Do No Harm
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of and build support for the recommendations in 'First Do No Harm', the report of the Independent Medicines and Medical Devices Safety Review, and to ensure the implementation of the recommendations by the UK government and others.

appg_groups.name: Fisheries
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Fisheries
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and support the UK fishing industry in Parliament, whilst exploring key questions for the future of fishing, processing, coastal communities and the marine environment.

appg_groups.name: a Fit and Healthy Childhood
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on a Fit and Healthy Childhood
appg_groups.purpose: To promote evidence-based discussion and produce reports on all aspects of childhood health and wellbeing including obesity; to inform policy decisions and public debate relating to childhood and to enable communications between interested parties and relevant parliamentarians.

appg_groups.name: Flood Prevention
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Flood Prevention
appg_groups.purpose: To discuss and further flood prevention across the UK, and minimise the impact of flooding on members of the public and British businesses.

appg_groups.name: Food and Drink
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Food and Drink
appg_groups.purpose: To act as the voice of food and drink in parliament. The Group serves to raise the profile of the food and drink industry, allowing MPs and Peers to explore issues affecting the industry through a programme of events, topical discussions, and site visits.

appg_groups.name: Ending the Need for Food Banks
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Ending the Need for Food Banks
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together parliamentarians from all parties with an interest in and commitment to ending the need for food banks; discussing the solutions that are needed; making recommendations to the relevant government departments that are key to ending the need for food banks.

appg_groups.name: Football
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Football
appg_groups.purpose: To hold meetings for parliamentarians about football issues and raise matters of importance with the football authorities.

appg_groups.name: Football Supporters
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Football Supporters
appg_groups.purpose: To represent the interests of match-going football fans and to support the aims and objectives of the Football Supporters' Association.

appg_groups.name: Foreign Affairs
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Foreign Affairs
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the importance of foreign affairs; to inform and stimulate debate on issues of relevance; and to introduce parliamentarians to experts and practitioners in the field.

appg_groups.name: Forestry and Tree Planting
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Forestry and Tree Planting
appg_groups.purpose: A successful forestry and wood-processing sector is positive for the economy, environment, biodiversity, recreation and health. But its future is under threat unless urgent action is taken. The sector needs a secure supply of timber and woodlands must be managed responsibly. The APPG will help tackle both of these issues.

appg_groups.name: Formula One
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Formula One
appg_groups.purpose: To support the sport and industry of Formula One.

appg_groups.name: Freedom of Speech
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Freedom of Speech
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum to promote and protect freedom of speech

appg_groups.name: Frozen British Pensions
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Frozen British Pensions
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together parliamentary supporters of the case to unfreeze British

appg_groups.name: Fruit Vegetables and Horticulture
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Fruit, Vegetables and Horticulture
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness and understanding of the domestic horticulture industry and be the voice of fruit, vegetable and horticultural growers both inside and outside parliament.

appg_groups.name: Fuel Poverty and Energy Efficiency
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Fuel Poverty and Energy Efficiency
appg_groups.purpose: To maintain awareness in Parliament of fuel poverty issues; to monitor and comment on progress against government targets across the UK to eradicate fuel poverty; to advocate policies that deliver affordable warmth for low income and vulnerable households with emphasis on improved domestic energy efficiency and efficient heating systems.

appg_groups.name: Funerals and Bereavement
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Funerals and Bereavement
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for the discussion of funeral and bereavement issues.

appg_groups.name: Further Education and Lifelong Learning
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Further Education and Lifelong Learning
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and develop the interests of further education, adult learning, skills sectors and to advise government ministers on matters of concern to those sectors.

appg_groups.name: Fusion Energy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Fusion Energy
appg_groups.purpose: To inform the present status of research. The APPG will look at how to maximise UK industry income and export potential; how fusion can benefit from government investment; how fusion fits into the new research landscape under UKRI; and how to to fully exploit the synergies between fusion research and advanced nuclear fission technologies.

appg_groups.name: Future Generations
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Future Generations
appg_groups.purpose: To create space for cross-party dialogue on combating short-termism and to identify ways to internalise concern for future generations into today's policy making.

appg_groups.name: the Future of Aviation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Future of Aviation
appg_groups.purpose: To promote policies that allow the UK's aviation, travel and tourism industries to recover from the impacts of COVID-19 and to call for the government to support and protect these industries and the jobs that they provide as vital parts of our national economy.

appg_groups.name: the Future of Retail
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Future of Retail
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a cross-party forum for parliamentarians to promote the value of the retail sector in collaboration with industry, to explore policy trends, develop support for the sector, maintain dialogue with government and engage stakeholders.

appg_groups.name: the Future of Work
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Future of Work
appg_groups.purpose: To advance (i) understanding and discussion about the impacts of technology on work (ii) dialogue and collaboration between government, business, unions, academics and civil society and (iii) practical solutions in response to key challenges and opportunities aimed at shaping a future of better work across the UK

benefits_details.source: The Institute for the Future Secretariat 9,001-10,500 03/11/2021 15/02/2022

appg_groups.name: Gambling Related Harm
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Gambling Related Harm
appg_groups.purpose: To address the issues associated with gambling related harm.

appg_groups.name: Game and Wildlife Conservation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Game and Wildlife Conservation
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for discussion of science-based game and wildlife conservation policies in the countryside.

appg_groups.name: Gasworks Redevelopment
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Gasworks Redevelopment
appg_groups.purpose: To look at concerns around the specifics of gasworks redevelopment.

appg_groups.name: General Aviation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on General Aviation
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the objective - as set out by the British Government - of making the UK the best country in the world for General Aviation through inspiring both current and future generations to take up science, technology, engineering and mathematics, thereby creating high-tech jobs and growth in our economy.

appg_groups.name: Genetic Haemochromatosis
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Genetic Haemochromatosis
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness about Haemochromatosis (Iron Overload)

appg_groups.name: Prevention of Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Prevention of Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
appg_groups.purpose: Providing parliamentarians with the information to act together to prevent genocides and crimes against humanity; learning from past genocides; supporting victims of genocides and crimes against humanity; promoting active peace building.

appg_groups.name: Geographically Protected Foods
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Geographically Protected Foods
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and protect the British foods that have shaped and built our culture and communities, and in particular to strengthen and defend the geographical indicator designation.

appg_groups.name: Global Deforestation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Global Deforestation
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a cross-party forum to discuss and promote greater awareness of the impacts of global deforestation, for communities, the climate, for nature and human rights. The group will consider the UK's role in contributing to global deforestation, as well as considering UK and international approaches

appg_groups.name: Global Education
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Global Education
appg_groups.purpose: To raise greater awareness of the factors affecting education in developing countries, and the government's obligations to help meet international goals for education for all. To work with all parties, international development organisations, education stakeholders (including unions) both nationally and internationally, to help secure a good quality education for all.

appg_groups.name: Global Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Global Health
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a parliamentary platform to identify and debate global health issues and concerns, raise the profile of global health within Parliament and government, and to prepare reports and make recommendations as appropriate.

appg_groups.name: Global Lesbian Gay Bisexual and Transgender LGBT Rights
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Global Lesbian, Gay, Bisexual, and Transgender (LGBT+) Rights
appg_groups.purpose: To ensure that global lesbian, gay, bisexual and transgender (LGBT+) issues are permanently part of the government’s agenda and the wider national conversation about human rights and equality, raised by well-briefed and motivated parliamentarians both nationally and internationally.

appg_groups.name: Global Security and Non-Proliferation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Global Security and Non-Proliferation
appg_groups.purpose: To exchange information and increase understanding of arms control, security and non-proliferation issues among British parliamentarians in particular, with the expectation that a more informed debate will have a positive impact on Britain's contribution to international disarmament and stability.

appg_groups.name: Global Tuberculosis
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Global Tuberculosis
appg_groups.purpose: To accelerate the progress towards ending the TB epidemic.

appg_groups.name: Green Deal Misselling
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Green Deal Misselling
appg_groups.purpose: To gather evidence from constituents who have been missold home improvements such as solar panels or insulation from rogue traders operating under the Green Deal. The group aims to find solutions for affected constituents and to prevent similar problems occurring under the new Green Deal.

appg_groups.name: the Green New Deal
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Green New Deal
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a cross-party platform for the development of a transformative Green New Deal for the UK.

benefits_details.source: The Green New Deal Group Secretariat 9,001-10,500 14/07/2021 15/10/2021

appg_groups.name: Gypsies Travellers and Roma
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Gypsies, Travellers and Roma
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians concerned about issues facing

appg_groups.name: Haemophilia and Contaminated Blood
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Haemophilia and Contaminated Blood
appg_groups.purpose: To promote awareness of, and campaign for, people with haemophilia and other bleeding disorders and people infected with blood-borne viruses due to contaminated blood and blood products used in their healthcare treatment.

appg_groups.name: Hairdressing Barbering and Cosmetology
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hairdressing, Barbering and Cosmetology
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the role of qualified, professional hairdressers and barbers, and facilitate an informed debate amongst parliamentarians regarding all aspects of the industry.

appg_groups.name: Hajj and Umrah
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hajj and Umrah
appg_groups.purpose: To establish facts about the UK Hajj and Umrah sectors, promote and enable an industry led partnership with government to set minimum standards and good practice for Hajj and Umrah services sold in the UK, promote active and precautionary health and wellbeing, and have appropriate consular and other support services.

appg_groups.name: Hate Crime
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hate Crime
appg_groups.purpose: To explore the challenges and impacts of all forms of hate crime and help develop and seek implementation of effective public policy to combat all forms of hate crime.

appg_groups.name: Health and the Natural Environment
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Health and the Natural Environment
appg_groups.purpose: To examine the physical health and mental wellbeing benefits to people of all ages that come from access to and connection with the natural environment.

appg_groups.name: Health in all Policies
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Health in all Policies
appg_groups.purpose: The group examines the effects of all national public policy on the health of the UK population with an emphasis on health inequalities between different population groups. It provides a discussion forum for parliamentarians and acts as a source of well-evidenced information on social, health and public health issues.

appg_groups.name: Healthcare Infrastructure
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Healthcare Infrastructure
appg_groups.purpose: To highlight the importance of high-quality healthcare infrastructure to support the NHS in meeting the demands of the future, including post- pandemic care.

appg_groups.name: Heritage Rail
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Heritage Rail
appg_groups.purpose: To brief parliamentarians about heritage railways, the contribution they make to their local and regional economies and the skills training opportunities involved.

appg_groups.name: HIV and AIDS
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on HIV and AIDS
appg_groups.purpose: To fight for the rights of people living with HIV and work to ensure all people living with HIV are able to access affordable medicines and a decent quality of life, free from stigma, discrimination and fear.

appg_groups.name: Hockey
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Hockey
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the sport of hockey in parliament, support the sport's growth and increase general participation in hockey.

appg_groups.name: Holocaust Memorial
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Holocaust Memorial
appg_groups.purpose: To promote holocaust memorial and education in parliament; and to support the establishment of a holocaust memorial and learning centre.

appg_groups.name: the Holy See
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Holy See
appg_groups.purpose: To foster friendly relations between the UK and the Holy See.

appg_groups.name: Ending Homelessness
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Ending Homelessness
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together parliamentarians of all parties with an interest in and commitment to ending homelessness; focus on all types of homelessness and differing solutions needed; make recommendations for the work of a wide range of departments who are key to ending homelessness.

appg_groups.name: Honour Based Abuse
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Honour Based Abuse
appg_groups.purpose: To debate and scrutinise issues relating to honour based abuse. To raise awareness of honour based abuse with a view to attempting to expose and eradicate such practices in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Hormone Pregnancy Tests
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hormone Pregnancy Tests
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of families affected by the use of the drug ‘Primodos’ and call for the implementation of recommendations in the Independent Medicines and Medical Devices Safety Review

appg_groups.name: the Horse
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Horse
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the welfare of horses (including all equines, horse riders and users) and matters affecting the horse industry.

appg_groups.name: Hospice and End of Life Care
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hospice and End of Life Care
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness and promote the needs of adults and children living with terminal or life-limiting conditions, and their families and carers, in parliament; and to promote person-centred, evidence-based policies to improve end of life care in all settings, including hospices, hospitals, care homes, and in people's own homes.

appg_groups.name: Hospitality and Tourism
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Hospitality and Tourism
appg_groups.purpose: To examine key issues, opportunities and challenges facing the hospitality sector across the UK.

appg_groups.name: Hospitality Events and Major Food and Drink Businesses in Wales
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Hospitality, Events and Major Food and Drink Businesses in Wales
appg_groups.purpose: To inform members of the innovations, markets, trading and other economic activity of the sectors involved; to help raise awareness of the economic value of the sectors to Wales and to offer support, where possible, to the businesses and their employees to help the promotion of job retention, future growth and sustainability.

appg_groups.name: Housing and Care for Older People
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Housing and Care for Older People
appg_groups.purpose: To promote discussion and set the agenda for developing better, more joined up housing care for older people, promising greater choices in later life.

appg_groups.name: Housing and Planning
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Housing and Planning
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians to discuss issues arising from housing and planning policy, primarily the delivery of housing, infrastructure and placemaking via the planning system.

appg_groups.name: Housing and Social Mobility
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Housing and Social Mobility
appg_groups.purpose: To champion social housing providers that support communities to secure sustainable livelihoods. To examine evidence led insights into the role that government, housing providers and stakeholders can play to best support social housing tenants and communities to access long-term, rewarding employment.

appg_groups.name: Housing in the North
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Housing in the North
appg_groups.purpose: Provides a forum for parliamentarians to discuss and advance housing and related policy across the three northern regions and seeks to ensure the

appg_groups.name: Housing Market and Housing Delivery
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Housing Market and Housing Delivery
appg_groups.purpose: To inform and stimulate debate on relevant areas of policy affecting the UK housing market; to promote the importance of the delivery of new homes across all tenures; and to introduce parliamentarians to those involved in delivering housing and other experts and practitioners in the field.

appg_groups.name: Human Microbiome
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Human Microbiome
appg_groups.purpose: To highlight the role of the human microbiome, especially of the gut, in physical and mental health and its potential to prevent many disorders and improve or slow others; inform debate about how this will save money for the Treasury and NHS; and enable communications between interested parties and relevant parliamentarians.

appg_groups.name: Human Trafficking and Modern Slavery
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Human Trafficking and Modern Slavery
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the scale and effects of human trafficking into the UK and EU; to seek solutions to reduce supply and demand and to improve welfare provisions for victims.

appg_groups.name: Human-Relevant Science
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Human-Relevant Science
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together MPs and Peers of all parties to accelerate the development and uptake of human relevant science in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Hydrogen
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Hydrogen
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians to engage with leading businesses and organisations that are working to enable the UK to meet its net-zero targets through implementation of hydrogen projects, and discuss policy options to support these.

appg_groups.name: Immigration Detention
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Immigration Detention
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness in parliament about immigration detention in the UK and its impacts; to connect parliamentarians with relevant research, organisations and experts, including people with lived experience of detention; and to advocate for evidence-based policy reforms and the welfare of detainees.

appg_groups.name: Immigration Law and Policy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Immigration Law and Policy
appg_groups.purpose: The group will consider some of the regulatory and legislative barriers migrants face and will identify solutions to inform policy makers in the future. The group will also provide opportunities for MPs and immigration lawyers to discuss and work together on key areas of immigration law and policy.

appg_groups.name: Inclusive Entrepreneurship
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Inclusive Entrepreneurship
appg_groups.purpose: To ensure that Parliament is fully informed on what is needed to create and sustain the most beneficial conditions for inclusive economic growth. To stimulate, encourage and nurture inclusive entrepreneurship throughout the country, and to engage with entrepreneurs who have protected characteristics, particularly disabled entrepreneurs.

appg_groups.name: Inclusive Growth
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Inclusive Growth
appg_groups.purpose: To create a parliamentary space for a high-level dialogue between MPs, peers, businesses, faith groups, trade unions and academics. The goal is to identify how to reconnect wealth creation and social justice.

appg_groups.name: Independent Education
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Independent Education
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum to discuss developments in the independent education sector, discuss issues facing the sector, highlight best practice, explore the wider contribution of the sector, share knowledge, and raise matters affecting the sector with government and sector leaders.

appg_groups.name: Indian Traditional Sciences
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Indian Traditional Sciences
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and facilitate informed discussions on issues concerning all Indian Traditional Sciences practised in the UK and abroad (Ayurveda, Yoga, Jyotish, Vastu, Unani and Sangeet) for inclusion into the NHS by providing a forum for cross-party parliamentarians, senior policy makers, academics, practitioners, leading community figures and stakeholders.

appg_groups.name: Industrial Heritage
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Industrial Heritage
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the industrial heritage of the United Kingdom and aim to help support British industrial heritage sites in a time of austerity.

appg_groups.name: Infant Feeding and Inequalities
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Infant Feeding and Inequalities
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of infant feeding and allow MPs, peers and policy stakeholders an opportunity to meet regularly to ensure that this topic remains a priority for HM Government with a view to reducing inequalities and improving health.

appg_groups.name: Infrastructure
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Infrastructure
appg_groups.purpose: To highlight the importance of economic infrastructure in the UK amongst parliamentarians, decision makers and industry and to discuss how to ensure society gets the infrastructure it needs.

appg_groups.name: Intellectual Property
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Intellectual Property
appg_groups.purpose: To debate and highlight the value of intellectual property and the importance of its promotion and protection. The Group meets several times a year on topical issues relating to intellectual property.

appg_groups.name: Intelligent Energy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Intelligent Energy
appg_groups.purpose: To develop among parliamentarians and key opinion formers a deeper understanding of energy efficiency and sustainable energy technologies and processes through parliamentary activity, public information and broad political debate.

appg_groups.name: Intensive Care
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Intensive Care
appg_groups.purpose: To highlight the role and work of intensive care and critical care within the health system and strengthen the understanding of Members about the impact of intensive care on the treatment and recovery of patients.

appg_groups.name: International Conservation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on International Conservation
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum to address wildlife conservation and biodiversity issues affecting our planet including but not limited to ecosystem collapse, species extinctions, land degradation, invasive species, illegal fishing and other threats to the natural world.

appg_groups.name: International Freedom of Religion or Belief
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for International Freedom of Religion or Belief
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness and profile of international Freedom of Religion or Belief (Article 18, UDHR) as a human right among UK parliamentarians, the media, government and the general public. The group also seeks to increase the effectiveness of the UK's contribution to international institutions charged with enforcing this human right.

appg_groups.name: International Students
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for International Students
appg_groups.purpose: To recognise the internationalisation and global prominence of UK education; promote the value of international students to UK education, economy and 'soft power'; raise awareness of issues which affect international students and UK education; and provide a platform for collaboration between parliamentarians, international education institutions and professionals and business leaders.

appg_groups.name: Investment Fraud
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Investment Fraud
appg_groups.purpose: To campaign on behalf of investment fraud victims.

appg_groups.name: Issues Affecting Men and Boys
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Issues Affecting Men and Boys
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of disadvantages and poor outcomes faced by men and boys in education, mental/physical health and law; to influence attitudes, role models, policy and legislation that will lead to positive differences to their well-being and lives.

appg_groups.name: Key Cities
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Key Cities
appg_groups.purpose: To offer a forum for parliamentarians to discuss matters of mutual interest across the UK's key cities. The Key Cities organisation is a cross-party initiative whose members are committed to ensuring that all UK cities are placed on a sustainable footing to deliver continued, inclusive economic growth.

appg_groups.name: Kinship Care
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Kinship Care
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of, and support for, kinship care and kinship carers by amplifying the voices and experiences of children in kinship care and their families. To inform parliamentarians and to promote policy and practice which supports more children to live safely within their family and friends network, when they cannot live with their parents.

appg_groups.name: Knife Crime and Violence Reduction
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Knife Crime and Violence Reduction
appg_groups.purpose: To evaluate policies and programmes aimed at reducing knife crime, gain better understanding of its root causes and the wider context of serious violence. To develop recommendations for new measures at both acute and preventative stages with a view to reducing levels of knife crime, and work with the cross-party Youth Violence Commission.

appg_groups.name: Land Value Capture
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Land Value Capture
appg_groups.purpose: To work in partnership with national and local government departments, land developers and others to create a forum for parliamentarians and interested stakeholders to discuss and develop innovative proposals to capture increases in land value, for the public benefit.

appg_groups.name: Lawyers and Judges at Risk Globally
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Lawyers and Judges at Risk Globally
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the challenges faced by lawyers and judges around the world and seek comprehensive responses to these issues.

appg_groups.name: Learning Disability
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Learning Disability
appg_groups.purpose: To look at the issues facing people with a learning disability and their families. The group looks at the key issues of the day, across areas including health, social care, education, employment and benefits.

appg_groups.name: Leasehold and Commonhold Reform
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Leasehold and Commonhold Reform
appg_groups.purpose: To consider matters relating to leasehold and commonhold legislation and regulation. Reduce opportunities for exploitation and improve cladding. Review the leasehold property Tribunal as a low-cost forum for disputes and redress including leasehold insurance and service charges which fall outside FCA regulation. Meet with and monitor government departments and publicly funded bodies working on leasehold.

appg_groups.name: Left Behind Neighbourhoods
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for 'Left Behind' Neighbourhoods
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness and understanding of what constitutes a ‘left behind’ neighbourhood and to explore, propose and advocate for the implementation of approaches designed to 'level up’ the social and economic outcomes of their residents and make their communities stronger and more resilient, including by applying learning about the impact of COVID-19.

appg_groups.name: Legal Aid
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Legal Aid
appg_groups.purpose: The group brings together members of the House of Lords and the House of Commons with the singular purpose to discuss issues relating to legal aid. The group meets regularly when parliament is sitting to discuss topics that are important in the legal aid sector and to hear from those that work within it.

appg_groups.name: Legal and Constitutional Affairs
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Legal and Constitutional Affairs
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness and build understanding of legal and constitutional issues, and provide a source of debate and expertise on these subjects.

benefits_details.source: The Law Society of England Joint Secretariat 1,501-3,000 29/09/2021 20/12/2021

appg_groups.name: Libraries Information and Knowledge
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Libraries, Information and Knowledge
appg_groups.purpose: To focus on the contribution of knowledge, information and libraries to the UK’s social, economic and industrial development.

appg_groups.name: Life Sciences
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Life Sciences
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness and understanding of the valuable contribution the life sciences sector provides to the health and wealth of the nation.

appg_groups.name: Limits to Growth
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Limits to Growth
appg_groups.purpose: To create the space for cross-party dialogue on environmental and social limits to growth; to assess the evidence for such limits, identify the risks and build support for appropriate responses; and to contribute to the international debate on redefining prosperity.

appg_groups.name: Listed Properties
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Listed Properties
appg_groups.purpose: To speak up for listed properties in the UK and raise awareness in parliament of the role played by their owners in protecting the nation's heritage; and to advocate policies that support owners in preserving listed properties, including tax and planning reform.

appg_groups.name: Liver Disease and Liver Cancer
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Liver Disease and Liver Cancer
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of liver disease and liver cancer with parliamentarians and government and to advocate for improvements in policy to secure better outcomes and care for liver disease and liver cancer patients.

appg_groups.name: Local Authority Pension Funds
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Local Authority Pension Funds
appg_groups.purpose: To discuss the issues and concerns of local authority pension funds and the work of the Local Authority Pension Fund Forum.

appg_groups.name: Local Democracy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Local Democracy
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the virtues of exiting forms of first tier local authorities; to inform policy making and initiatives affecting first tier local authorities; and to stimulate debate on models of community governance.

appg_groups.name: Local Government
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Local Government
appg_groups.purpose: To discuss issues of interest and concern to parliamentarians and councillors about local government.

appg_groups.name: London
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for London
appg_groups.purpose: To promote London in the interests of all its people, places and businesses as a global city and powerhouse of the national economy.

appg_groups.name: London as a Global City
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for London as a Global City
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG will bring together parliamentarians and London business to promote awareness of the vital role London plays as the UK’s global city and the policies needed to support this position. It will encourage investment in London’s continued success for the benefit of Global Britain’s reputation and competitiveness.

appg_groups.name: Londons Planning and Built Environment
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for London's Planning and Built Environment
appg_groups.purpose: To debate the key issues facing the changing shape of London, from quality housing delivery, to the changing shape of the skyline, to affordability of living and work spaces, bringing together MPs and Peers from across the political parties to help shape a better city in a period of major growth.

appg_groups.name: Longevity
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Longevity
appg_groups.purpose: To address the socioeconomic, cultural, scientific and technological issues relating to our ageing demographic and to promote living healthier and longer lives. The APPG's mission is to meet the government goal of five more years of healthy life expectancy by 2035 while minimising health inequalities (‘HLE + 5’).

appg_groups.name: Looked After Children and Care Leavers
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Looked After Children and Care Leavers
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the voice of care-experienced children and young people, in order to promote first-class government policy for children in care and care leavers.

appg_groups.name: Magnitsky Sanctions
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Magnitsky Sanctions
appg_groups.purpose: To raise the profile of human rights and anti-corruption sanctions within parliament, to examine specific situations where sanctions may be appropriate, and to consider changes to the operation of the UK’s Magnitsky Sanctions legislation to improve its efficiency and impact.

appg_groups.name: Malaria and Neglected Tropical Diseases
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Malaria and Neglected Tropical Diseases
appg_groups.purpose: To inform parliamentarians of the devastation that malaria and the neglected tropical diseases (NTDs) cause. Malaria and many of the NTDs are tractable disease. Suffering from malaria is avoidable. Malaria and many of the NTDs are treatable.

appg_groups.name: Management
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Management
appg_groups.purpose: To drive UK productivity and social well-being through promoting closer understanding between parliamentarians and UK managers and leaders from across all sectors.

appg_groups.name: Marine Energy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Marine Energy
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the economic, supply chain and energy security benefits from the development of marine energy resources in and around the UK.

appg_groups.name: Maternity
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Maternity
appg_groups.purpose: To improve the quality of maternity services, raise awareness of the contribution maternity care can make to public health, and improve support during the first 1000 days of parenthood.

appg_groups.name: Media Freedom
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Media Freedom
appg_groups.purpose: To promote media freedom in countries around the world and to strengthen the protection of journalists.

appg_groups.name: Media Literacy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Media Literacy
appg_groups.purpose: Forum for parliamentarians to discuss how to equip young people and wider society with the critical thinking skills needed today. To work with industry, regulators and businesses to put forward positive proposals for change.

appg_groups.name: Access to Medical Cannabis under Prescription
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Access to Medical Cannabis under Prescription
appg_groups.purpose: To help secure appropriate access to medical cannabis on the NHS in its various forms including full plant extract containing both CBD and THC in formulations produced to a consistent high quality pharmaceutical grade and manufactured to GMP standard.

appg_groups.name: Medical Research
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Medical Research
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum and network for parliamentarians with an interest in medical research; to protect and strengthen the UK's world-leading medical research environment by facilitating collaboration between parliamentarians and medical research bodies and providing up-to-date information on developments in medical research, including aspects of public health, the ethics of research and the implications of research findings for society.

appg_groups.name: Menopause
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Menopause
appg_groups.purpose: To tackle the lack of understanding around menopause amongst policymakers, the public and employers. The APPG will also provide a platform in the heart of Parliament that highlights the issues and challenges around menopause that deserve attention, as well as act as a forum for discussion.

appg_groups.name: Mental Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Mental Health
appg_groups.purpose: To inform parliamentarians about all aspects of mental health.

appg_groups.name: Mersey Dee North Wales
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Mersey Dee North Wales
appg_groups.purpose: To forge further economic, social and political links in the unique, urban cross-border areas of North Wales, the Wirral and Cheshire West and Chester.

appg_groups.name: Metal Stone and Heritage Crime
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Metal, Stone and Heritage Crime
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the social and economic impact of metal, stone and heritage crime.

appg_groups.name: Microplastics
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Microplastics
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the effect microplastics have on the environment. The group will also work cross-party with stakeholders to discuss potential policy solutions.

appg_groups.name: Migration
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Migration
appg_groups.purpose: To support the emergence of mainstream, progressive policy debate on migration in the UK parliament.

appg_groups.name: Mindfulness
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Mindfulness
appg_groups.purpose: To review research evidence, current best practice, extent and success of implementation, and potential developments in the application of mindfulness within a range of policy areas, and to develop policy recommendations for government based on these findings.

appg_groups.name: Minimally Invasive Cancer Therapies
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Minimally Invasive Cancer Therapies
appg_groups.purpose: To drive awareness of minimally invasive cancer therapies and to ensure that eligible patients across the UK can have timely access.

appg_groups.name: Mining and Quarrying
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Mining and Quarrying
appg_groups.purpose: To inform parliamentarians interested in the mining and quarrying industries and their products, i.e. aggregates, cement, concrete, dimension stone, industrial lime, mortar and silica sand.

appg_groups.name: Miscarriages of Justice
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Miscarriages of Justice
appg_groups.purpose: To examine the structural problems within the criminal justice system which result in miscarriages of justice and to provide a forum from which to improve access to justice for those who have been wrongly convicted.

appg_groups.name: Missing Children and Adults
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Missing Children and Adults
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness about the issues faced by children and adults who go missing from home or care and the families they leave behind.

appg_groups.name: Modern Languages
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Modern Languages
appg_groups.purpose: To explore the educational, skills-related, employment, competitive and cultural benefits of learning and using languages throughout the UK; to provide a parliamentary forum for information exchange and consultation on languages and linguists; to encourage and support policies and action improving the take-up of languages in schools, further and higher education, in the workplace and in the community.

appg_groups.name: Mortgage Prisoners
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Mortgage Prisoners
appg_groups.purpose: Solving the problems caused to mortgage prisoners in the UK by ensuring that all of them get a fair deal and fair treatment.

appg_groups.name: Motor Neurone Disease
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Motor Neurone Disease
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of Motor Neurone Disease (MND) and to provide a forum for discussion of the issues facing people with MND and their families.

appg_groups.name: Motorcycle Speedway
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Motorcycle Speedway
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians with an interest in the sport of motorcycle speedway and to liaise with British Speedway and others with an interest in the sport.

appg_groups.name: Motorsport
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Motorsport
appg_groups.purpose: To support motorsport.

appg_groups.name: Multiple Sclerosis
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Multiple Sclerosis
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the interests of people affected by MS (Multiple Sclerosis).

appg_groups.name: Muscular Dystrophy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Muscular Dystrophy
appg_groups.purpose: Raises awareness of all types of muscular dystrophy and neuromuscular conditions and promotes links between parliament, individuals and families affected by these muscle-wasting conditions, charities, scientists, health professionals and decision-makers.

appg_groups.name: Museums
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Museums
appg_groups.purpose: To highlight and promote the interests of museums across the UK.

appg_groups.name: Music
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Music
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a discussion forum between the music industry and parliamentarians.

appg_groups.name: Music Education
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Music Education
appg_groups.purpose: To support parliamentarians engaging in discussions relating to music education through early years, primary, secondary, SEND, further and higher education, and lifelong learning. The Group has a particular focus on Curriculum, the National Plan for Music Education, challenges facing higher education,and progression into the creative and cultural sector.

appg_groups.name: Muslim Women
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Muslim Women
appg_groups.purpose: To support social justice and equality for Muslim women and transform their lives by debating, scrutinising, investigating and raising awareness of issues affecting them to influence practice, policy, legislation and attitudes.

appg_groups.name: Mutuals
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Mutuals
appg_groups.purpose: To discuss and support mutuals.

appg_groups.name: Myalgic Encephalomyelitis ME
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Myalgic Encephalomyelitis (ME)
appg_groups.purpose: To seek to improve health, social care, education and employment opportunities for people with ME and encourage biomedical research into the cause and treatment of ME.

appg_groups.name: National Parks
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for National Parks
appg_groups.purpose: To inform members of key issues relating to England's national parks (NPs), their authorities and areas that may merit NP status; to discuss issues of common concern; to advance the place of NPs in society within Parliament, focusing on conservation and enhancement, opportunities for public learning and enjoyment, and the well-being of NP communities.

appg_groups.name: the National Trust
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the National Trust
appg_groups.purpose: To apply parliamentary scrutiny to the operational and strategic direction of the National Trust.

appg_groups.name: Nature
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Nature
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for engaging and inspiring parliamentarians and others with the natural world, the major threats that it faces today, and the positives that come form a healthy natural environment.

appg_groups.name: New and Advanced Technologies
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on New and Advanced Technologies
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of new and advanced technologies in Parliament and encourage parliamentarians and other stakeholders to engage with technology-related issues.

appg_groups.name: New Towns
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on New Towns
appg_groups.purpose: To celebrate the contribution made by the UK’s New Towns and highlight the challenges and opportunities they face. This APPG aims to change attitudes to the New Towns and gain recognition for them; make the case for investment in their growth and renewal; and positively help shape future government policy.

appg_groups.name: the Night Time Economy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Night Time Economy
appg_groups.purpose: To recognise the cultural and economic importance of nightlife to the UK. To provide a cross-party voice for nightlife businesses, supply chains and patrons. To support parliamentarians’ understanding of how the sector operates. To identify solutions to challenges facing the sector and how nightlife can support the UK’s economic recovery from Covid-19.

appg_groups.name: No Recourse to Public Funds
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on No Recourse to Public Funds
appg_groups.purpose: To draw attention to the challenges faced by destitute migrants who have no recourse to public funds, with a particular focus on families and vulnerable adults, and to contribute to the development of policy and legislation in this area.

appg_groups.name: Nuclear Energy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Nuclear Energy
appg_groups.purpose: A forum for parliamentarians to discuss civil nuclear energy on a cross-party basis.

appg_groups.name: Nursery Schools Nursery and Reception Classes
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Nursery Schools, Nursery and Reception Classes
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the role of high quality early childhood education in improving children's life chances; and to provide opportunities for parliamentarians to discuss early years policy issues with practitioners and researchers.

appg_groups.name: Nutrition for Development
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Nutrition for Development
appg_groups.purpose: To support and challenge the UK government to maintain their leadership on global nutrition and to make a significant pledge at the Nutrition for Growth summit in Tokyo 2020.

appg_groups.name: Obesity
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Obesity
appg_groups.purpose: To call on the government to prioritise and drive increased investment and resource into both the prevention and treatment of obesity.

appg_groups.name: Occupational Safety and Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Occupational Safety and Health
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for the discussion and promotion of issues relating to occupational safety and health; to provide information to members of both Houses of Parliament on topical issues; and to publish reports as and when necessary.

appg_groups.name: the Olympic and Paralympic Games
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Olympic and Paralympic Games
appg_groups.purpose: To be the cross-party voice in parliament promoting the Olympic and Paralympic Games and providing a focal point for MPs and Peers with an interest in the Olympic and Paralympic movements.

appg_groups.name: One Punch Assaults
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for One Punch Assaults
appg_groups.purpose: To look at justice and sentencing reform, and raising awareness of one punch assaults.

appg_groups.name: Online and Home Electrical Safety
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Online and Home Electrical Safety
appg_groups.purpose: To raise parliamentary awareness of issues relating to electrical safety online and in domestic dwellings and to promote the prevention of accidents with electricity; to provide a forum for parliamentarians to discuss issues pertinent to their constituents on electrical safety; and to hold inquiries into policy issues and provide reports.

appg_groups.name: Open Banking and Payments
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Open Banking and Payments
appg_groups.purpose: To ensure that Open Banking delivers maximum benefit and value to consumers, businesses and government; promotes effective competition and choice; reduces the cost of payments; supports innovation; and ensures that customers benefit from technological advances, and that new entrants and smaller providers can compete more fairly.

appg_groups.name: Opera
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Opera
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a focal point for MPs and Peers with an interest in opera; to further the appreciation of opera; and to provide a link between this art form and Parliament.

appg_groups.name: Osteoporosis and Bone Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Osteoporosis and Bone Health
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of osteoporosis amongst parliamentarians and to influence legislation and policy makers to improve the lives of people living with the condition. The APPG will consider how to promote behavioural change and systems changes so people of all ages can strengthen their bones and prevent osteoporosis.

appg_groups.name: Ovarian Cancer
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Ovarian Cancer
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for MPs and peers to discuss ovarian cancer related issues; to raise areas of concern with government or other policy makers; to raise the profile of ovarian cancer within parliament and seek opportunities to help improve survival and quality of life for women.

appg_groups.name: the Packaging Manufacturing Industry
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Packaging Manufacturing Industry.
appg_groups.purpose: To create a better understanding of the UK packaging manufacturing

appg_groups.name: the Pakistani Minorities
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Pakistani Minorities
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of and help eliminate discrimination and persecution by the state and others; and to help develop an inclusive and tolerant Pakistan.

appg_groups.name: Pandemic Response and Recovery
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Pandemic Response and Recovery
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for politicians, scientists, health professionals, economists, business leaders and other experts; to facilitate broad, balanced and open discussion; to inform a more focussed and flexible approach to government policy; to reach for new solutions in pandemic management which prevent avoidable suffering and loss in the future.

appg_groups.name: PANS and PANDAS
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on PANS and PANDAS
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness about PANS (Pediatric Acute-onset Neuropsychiatric Syndrome) and PANDAS (Pediatric Autoimmune Neuropsychiatric Disorders Associated with Streptococcal Infections) and provide a forum in Parliament with a focus on current legislation, policy and evidence on treatment in order to improve detection, diagnosis and provision of treatment.

appg_groups.name: Parental Participation in Education
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Parental Participation in Education
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the benefits of parents being actively engaged in their children’s education and building close and successful relationships between homes and schools.

appg_groups.name: Park Homes
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Park Homes
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together parliamentarians, park homeowners and industry representatives to discuss issues of common interest including legislation and its enforcement to eliminate abuse and disadvantage.

appg_groups.name: Parkinsons
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Parkinson's
appg_groups.purpose: The group aims to keep Parkinson's on the political agenda to ensure government initiatives and policies meet the needs of people with the condition and their families and carers.

appg_groups.name: Parkrun
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Parkrun
appg_groups.purpose: To support parkrun and improve public health.

appg_groups.name: Parks and Green Spaces
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Parks and Green Spaces
appg_groups.purpose: To address the most urgent issues affecting our parks and green spaces, including but not limited to funding, skills, inequality of access and provision, climate change, biodiversity and the impact they have on the nation’s health and wellbeing.

appg_groups.name: the Peak District
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Peak District
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together parliamentarians and conservationists to discuss and raise awareness of the Peak District National Park and seek ways to improve the area.

appg_groups.name: Pedagogy Curriculum and Accountability
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Pedagogy, Curriculum and Accountability
appg_groups.purpose: To consider and keep under review developments in pedagogy, the curriculum and accountability with particular reference to the education system in England.

appg_groups.name: Penal Affairs
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Penal Affairs
appg_groups.purpose: To increase members' knowledge of penal affairs and to work through parliamentary channels to reform the penal system.

appg_groups.name: Pension Clawback
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Pension Clawback
appg_groups.purpose: To campaign for HSBC UK to remove state deduction, more commonly known as pension integration or 'clawback', from the post-1974 Midland Bank Defined Benefit Pension Scheme. To raise awareness of pension clawback more generally, especially in cases where it has been poorly communicated, and to highlight its discriminatory impacts.

appg_groups.name: Pensions
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Pensions
appg_groups.purpose: To develop and encourage pensions arrangements in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Performing Arts Education and Training
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Performing Arts Education and Training
appg_groups.purpose: To support parliamentarians in discussions relating to: appropriate training, education, assessment and professional practices across the performing arts, particularly drama, dance and musical theatre; practitioners continuing professional development within the creative and cultural industries; wider benefits of engagement with the performing arts for students, practitioners and audiences.

appg_groups.name: Perpetrators of Domestic Abuse
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Perpetrators of Domestic Abuse
appg_groups.purpose: To ensure MPs and Peers have access to information about (a) perpetrators of domestic violence and (b) what makes an effective and safe perpetrator programme. To link MPs and Peers with local programmes, in order to increase their understanding of the above.

appg_groups.name: Personal Banking and Fairer Financial Services
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Personal Banking and Fairer Financial Services
appg_groups.purpose: To identify aspects of personal banking and financial services where the service providers or regulators have not delivered, or are not delivering, excellence and appropriate consumer protection; to facilitate and encourage all stakeholders to work together to resolve past and present shortcomings, and to bring about positive changes.

appg_groups.name: Philanthropy and Social Investment
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Philanthropy and Social Investment
appg_groups.purpose: To further understanding of the role of philanthropy, giving and social investment in parliament, and to act as a discussion forum for politicians, philanthropists, social investors and experts to develop policy to improve and increase the amount of giving and social investment to good causes in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Photography
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Photography
appg_groups.purpose: To promote interest in photography.

appg_groups.name: Photonics and Quantum
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Photonics and Quantum
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the photonics industry and recognise the impact it makes on the UK economy and its potential for future economic growth.

appg_groups.name: Pigeon Racing
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Pigeon Racing
appg_groups.purpose: To promote greater understanding and appreciation of the social, sporting and cultural benefits of pigeon racing.

appg_groups.name: Policing and Security
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Policing and Security
appg_groups.purpose: To promote better understanding of policing and security issues amongst both Houses of Parliament.

appg_groups.name: Political Literacy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Political Literacy
appg_groups.purpose: The key aim of this APPG will be to provide evidence for the importance of political literacy education in promoting youth participation in democratic life. The ultimate goal of this APPG will be to ensure that all young people become politically literate by the time they finish their secondary education.

appg_groups.name: Population Development and Reproductive Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Population, Development and Reproductive Health
appg_groups.purpose: To ensure the full implementation of the International Conference on Population and Development's programme of Action with specific reference to stabilisation of the world's population through choice and ensuring sustainable development in the UK and abroad.

appg_groups.name: Post Offices
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Post Offices
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the important economic and social contribution post offices and post masters make; to ensure their position as a vital public service; and to provide input into the areas of public policy which affect the post office.

appg_groups.name: Poverty
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Poverty
appg_groups.purpose: To provide awareness of the impact of poverty, its causes and consequences, and to encourage the spread of good practice to alleviate and eliminate it.

benefits_details.source: Child Poverty Action Group Joint Secretariat 3,001-4,500 12/02/2021 14/06/2021

appg_groups.name: Prescribed Drug Dependence
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Prescribed Drug Dependence
appg_groups.purpose: To recognise, address and reduce the harm caused by prescribed drug dependence.

appg_groups.name: the Preventing Sexual Violence in Conflict Initiative
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Preventing Sexual Violence in Conflict Initiative
appg_groups.purpose: To continue the work carried out by the previous APPG on PSVI (Prevention of Sexual Violence in Conflict Initiative) and promote the cause through supporting the conference and engaging with outside bodies to support this initiative.

appg_groups.name: the Private Rented Sector
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Private Rented Sector
appg_groups.purpose: To raise greater awareness of the private rented housing sector in Parliament; to provide a forum for parliamentarians to discuss issues pertinent to the sector and engage with ministers, landlords, tenants and other interested parties; and to hold inquiries into policy and operational issues on the sector and produce reports.

appg_groups.name: Professional Sales
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Professional Sales
appg_groups.purpose: To improve recognition by parliament and industry of the importance of sales and its impact on the UK economy; to promote and advance sales as a profession; to boost the success of British industry, especially in international trade.

appg_groups.name: Psychology
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Psychology
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness amongst parliamentarians and policymakers of the importance and relevance of psychology, combining research and best practice briefings to ensure that MPs have access to a psychological evidence- based approach to policy development.

appg_groups.name: Public Legal Education and Pro Bono
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Public Legal Education and Pro Bono
appg_groups.purpose: To promote pro bono work and public legal education (PLE) nationally and internationally, to provide a forum for parliamentarians to work with the legal sector to foster a supportive policy environment for PLE and pro-bono, and encourage/raise awareness of initiatives to improve legal capability and free legal services provision.

appg_groups.name: Publishing
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Publishing
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the value of high quality publishing to UK society, culture and the economy. To foster a better understanding among parliamentarians about publishers, booksellers and associated fields, all of whom contribute to a world-leading publishing sector.

appg_groups.name: the Queens Platinum Jubilee 2022
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Queen’s Platinum Jubilee 2022
appg_groups.purpose: To celebrate the occasion of The Queen’s Platinum Jubilee 2022, the aim of which will be to support and encourage the observation and celebrations surrounding the occasion of the 70th anniversary of the accession to the throne of Her Majesty the Queen and to assist with the liaison and organisation of this historic event in the Houses of Parliament, thereof.

appg_groups.name: Race and Community
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Race and Community
appg_groups.purpose: The group focuses on issues of racial justice. It aims to increase the coverage in parliament of issues relating to race and ethnicity; to update members on these issues as well as on up-to-date research; and to connect the group with charities and other organisations working on these issues around the country.

appg_groups.name: Race Equality in Education
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Race Equality in Education
appg_groups.purpose: To advance race equality in the education sector. To support children and students from ethnic minority backgrounds, to enhance education environments, and to increase racial diversity in teaching across the UK.

appg_groups.name: Racing and Bloodstock
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Racing and Bloodstock
appg_groups.purpose: To keep parliamentarians and the government up to date with issues in horseracing and bloodstock; to foster good relations with the various parts of horseracing, and between them; and for connected purposes.

appg_groups.name: Radiotherapy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Radiotherapy
appg_groups.purpose: To provide an effective voice for radiotherapy and improve access to radiotherapy for cancer patients, ensuring no-one has to travel more than 45 minutes to their nearest radiotherapy unit.
