To ensure radiotherapy receives increased funding so that patients are allowed to have the best radiotherapy for their individual cancer.

appg_groups.name: Rail in the North
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Rail in the North
appg_groups.purpose: To discuss rail services in the North of England.

appg_groups.name: Rail in Wales
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Rail in Wales
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians to discuss issues related to the rail network and industry in Wales. To conduct specific inquiries, and to hear directly from representatives of the rail industry.

appg_groups.name: Rare Genetic and Undiagnosed Conditions
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Rare, Genetic and Undiagnosed Conditions
appg_groups.purpose: To increase awareness in Parliament of rare, genetic and undiagnosed conditions and help to ensure that patients and families affected by those conditions have access to appropriate care and support.

appg_groups.name: Recovery from Addictions
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Recovery from Addictions
appg_groups.purpose: To develop and promote policies which ensure individuals, families and communities affected by addiction have the services and resources necessary to overcome challenges caused by addiction in the immediate and longer-term. To develop and promote policies which ensure individuals, families and communities affected by addiction have the services and resources necessary to overcome challenges caused by addiction in the immediate and longer-term.

appg_groups.name: Refugees
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Refugees
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for the discussion of issues relating to refugees, both in the UK and abroad, and to promote the welfare of refugees.

appg_groups.name: Regeneration and Development
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Regeneration and Development
appg_groups.purpose: To inform and stimulate debate on relevant areas of policy affecting regeneration & development and to introduce parliamentarians to experts and practitioners in the field.

appg_groups.name: Relationships
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Relationships
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and develop marriage and relationship skills and support, identifying best practice within the UK and internationally, to help reduce interparental conflict as well as family breakdown, and support both adult and child mental health and wellbeing.

appg_groups.name: Religion in the Media
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Religion in the Media
appg_groups.purpose: To improve religious literacy in media and politics and to provide a platform where the regulatory, commercial and cultural factors which influence depictions of faith can be discussed.

appg_groups.name: Religious Education
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Religious Education
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a medium through which parliamentarians and organisations with an interest in religious education can discuss the current provision of religious education, press for continuous improvement, promote public understanding and advocate rigorous education for every young person in religious and non-religious world views.

appg_groups.name: Renters and Rental Reform
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Renters and Rental Reform
appg_groups.purpose: To raise the conditions of renters and provide a space in Parliament to have their voices heard; receive briefings from external organisations about the latest studies and research with concerns to the private rented sector; work co-operatively and in a cross-party way with the government on the introduction of the forthcoming Rental Reform Bill; arrange events in Parliament to allow for tenant organisations to meet with MPs to raise their concerns.

appg_groups.name: Reserves and Cadets
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Reserves and Cadets
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the interests of reserve forces and cadets in parliament.

appg_groups.name: Respiratory Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Respiratory Health
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the importance of respiratory health and to promote effective policy for improving treatments and outcomes for respiratory illnesses.

appg_groups.name: Restorative Justice
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Restorative Justice
appg_groups.purpose: To examine the use of restorative justice principles within the UK justice system and beyond; to raise the profile of restorative justice principles within Parliamnent; and to provide opportunities for policy discussion and consultation.

appg_groups.name: Retail Crime
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Retail Crime
appg_groups.purpose: To highlight the cost of retail crime to the high street (£600m a year), improve understanding of how this type of crime affects small businesses and what impact incidents of retail crime will have an effect on our high streets if left unchecked.

appg_groups.name: Road Freight and Logistics
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Road Freight and Logistics
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and represent the interests of the UK road haulage and logistics sector and provide a forum to discuss opportunities and challenges.

appg_groups.name: Road Passenger Transport - Recovery and Renewal
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Road Passenger Transport - Recovery and Renewal
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for all stakeholders in the road passenger transport industry to consider and raise awareness of matters relating to the industry’s recovery from the effects of the Covid19 Pandemic and renewal in the face of climate change

appg_groups.name: the Rights of the Rohingya
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Rights of the Rohingya
appg_groups.purpose: In recognising the persecution, murder and other atrocities committed against the Rohingya, the group will work towards protecting and enhancing the human rights and status of the Rohingya, and will assess and scrutinise any repatriation agreement made between Bangladesh and Myanmar.

appg_groups.name: Rowing
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Rowing
appg_groups.purpose: To support the sport of rowing.

appg_groups.name: the Rule of Law
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Rule of Law
appg_groups.purpose: To promote parliamentary and public discussion of the rule of law as a practical concept and to mainstream the importance of the rule of law in Parliament.

appg_groups.name: Running
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Running
appg_groups.purpose: To provide government and related bodies with a better understanding of the running sector and to increase recognition and support for safe, standardised, consistent running and racing.

appg_groups.name: Rural Business and the Rural Powerhouse
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Rural Business and the Rural Powerhouse
appg_groups.purpose: To examine the areas that would reduce the productivity gap between urban and rural areas.

appg_groups.name: Rural Services
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Rural Services
appg_groups.purpose: To promote a debate on the provision of rural services and to issue periodic reports.

appg_groups.name: Safeguarding in Faith Communities
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Safeguarding in Faith Communities
appg_groups.purpose: To focus on safeguarding concerns relevant to any community of faith, belief or religion. The APPG is attempting to raise awareness and improve policy and practice in relation to safeguarding in faith communities and by encouraging both the opportunity and responsibility of those faith groups and communities in creating safer places for all.

appg_groups.name: School Exclusions and Alternative Provision
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for School Exclusions and Alternative Provision
appg_groups.purpose: To improve outcomes for vulnerable children by facilitating upstream working to reduce preventable exclusions and improve the quality of education for children excluded from school.

appg_groups.name: School Food
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on School Food
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a cross-party parliamentary platform for the discussion of school food with stakeholders; to keep school food, child hunger and food education on the political agenda following the spot-light given during the pandemic; and to campaign to ensure that children receive high quality meals in and outside of school.

appg_groups.name: Science and Technology in Agriculture
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Science and Technology in Agriculture
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians and stakeholders to debate and highlight the value of science and technology in agriculture.

appg_groups.name: Sepsis
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Sepsis
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a medium through which parliamentarians, organisations and those affected by Sepsis can discuss the current provision for the condition, which claims 48,000 lives in the UK every year, promote public understanding and advocate for simple, timely interventions to be implemented as standard across the NHS; whilst considering sepsis as a critical component of the response to infections management including infection prevention and a patient-centred approach to antimicrobial stewardship.

appg_groups.name: Sexual and Reproductive Health in the UK
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Sexual and Reproductive Health in the UK
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the needs of women seeking abortion and the importance of improving all aspects of the sexual ad reproductive health of men and women in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Shared Ownership Housing
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Shared Ownership Housing
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together MPs and Peers of all parties with policy makers, business leaders and industry experts, to discuss and promote shared ownership, its potential to increase housing supply, and to protect shared ownership customers.

appg_groups.name: Shipbuilding and Ship Repair
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Shipbuilding and Ship Repair
appg_groups.purpose: To ensure UK sovereign defence capability in the maritime sphere, and to ensure that UK companies and supply chains compete on a level playing field.

appg_groups.name: Shooting and Conservation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Shooting and Conservation
appg_groups.purpose: To inform parliamentarians and to act as a forum for the exchange of views on shooting and conservation.

appg_groups.name: the Short Lets Sector
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Short Lets Sector
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians, short-let platforms, local authorities and other affected sectors to discuss issues arising from the growing short- lets market; and to advise on ways in which to optimise the positive contributions of this sector and avoid undesired impacts.

appg_groups.name: Single Parent Families
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Single Parent Families
appg_groups.purpose: To collaborate across the political spectrum to campaign against legislative loopholes that disadvantage single parents, and for positive representation of

appg_groups.name: Sixth Form Education
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Sixth Form Education
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and support the interests of institutions that deliver sixth form education, and to advise government on the challenges facing 16 to18 education.

appg_groups.name: Skills Careers and Employment
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Skills, Careers and Employment
appg_groups.purpose: Cross-party coalition of parliamentarians devoted to raising the profile of skills and employment policy. Brings together Parliament, employers, and the skills sector to ensure that skills policy promotes social mobility, lifelong learning opportunities and local economic growth.

appg_groups.name: Small and Micro Business
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Small and Micro Business
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of small and micro business issues in parliament.

appg_groups.name: Small Modular Reactors
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Small Modular Reactors
appg_groups.purpose: To support the roll-out of small modular reactors (SMR) to sites across the UK, to champion the SMR model, to encourage a diversity of design and providers and to engage UK industry in the development of SMRs including supporting engineering jobs in the UK.

appg_groups.name: SME Small and Medium-sized Enterprises House Builders
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for SME (Small and Medium-sized Enterprises) House Builders
appg_groups.purpose: To examine the operations of SME (Small and Medium-sized Enterprises) house builders in the UK; discover and highlight best practice; review the regulatory environment affecting the market, looking at ways of improving the delivery of new homes, and making recommendations on how Parliament can improve regulation to deliver more effective building of homes by SMEs.

appg_groups.name: Smoking and Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Smoking and Health
appg_groups.purpose: To monitor and discuss the health and social effects of smoking; to review potential changes to existing legislation to reduce levels of smoking; to assess the latest medical techniques to assist in smoking cessation; and to act as a resource for the group's members on all issues relating to smoking and public health.

appg_groups.name: Snooker
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Snooker
appg_groups.purpose: To support the sport of snooker.

appg_groups.name: Social Enterprise
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Social Enterprise
appg_groups.purpose: To showcase social enterprises and discuss issues important to the social enterprise sector.

appg_groups.name: Social Integration
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Social Integration
appg_groups.purpose: To drive forward a cross-party conversation on policy solutions to break down barriers to integration and create opportunities for people from all walks of life to connect with each other and build bonds of trust.

appg_groups.name: Social Media
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Social Media
appg_groups.purpose: To drive policy change that mitigates the negatives and maximises the positives of social media for young people.

appg_groups.name: Social Mobility
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Social Mobility
appg_groups.purpose: To discuss and evaluate key issues and indicators of social mobility and barriers to it. To hold seminars and meetings to present and highlight the latest research on social mobility.

appg_groups.name: Social Science and Policy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Social Science and Policy
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together parliamentarians and social scientists and by doing so demonstrate the relevance and value of social science research.

appg_groups.name: Social Work
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Social Work
appg_groups.purpose: To promote knowledge and understanding of social work, the role that social workers have, and the issues that impact the lives of those in receipt of social work support.

appg_groups.name: the South East
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the South East
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for parliamentarians to discuss, with others, how to promote and develop the South East region as a great place to live, work and do business.

appg_groups.name: the great South West
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the great South West
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the economic and social advancement of the South West region as a great place to live, work and do business.

appg_groups.name: South Western Railway
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on South Western Railway
appg_groups.purpose: To champion the needs of constituents and passengers who travel on the railway that operates in/out of London Waterloo and the geographical area that extends from London Waterloo to Portsmouth, Weymouth, Exeter, Bristol and Reading, the network within these points and connecting lines.

appg_groups.name: Southern Rail
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Southern Rail
appg_groups.purpose: To scrutinise the operation and performance of the Southern Rail franchise with a view to ensuring service improvement by the franchise. The group will act for the best interests of passengers by providing challenge to all organisations, including the government, which have a bearing on operational performance.

appg_groups.name: Sovereign Defence Manufacturing Capability
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Sovereign Defence Manufacturing Capability
appg_groups.purpose: To facilitate a continuing discussion on how the UK can sustain a sovereign defence manufacturing capability.

appg_groups.name: Sovereign Wealth Funds
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Sovereign Wealth Funds
appg_groups.purpose: To highlight the role of sovereign wealth funds in the UK and global economies, to discuss what risks and opportunities major wealth funds see in

appg_groups.name: Special Educational Needs and Disabilities
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Special Educational Needs and Disabilities
appg_groups.purpose: To support special schools and SEND (Special Educational Needs and Disabilities) provision in mainstream school and college settings.

appg_groups.name: Speech and Language Difficulties
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Speech and Language Difficulties
appg_groups.purpose: To make parliament aware that the ability to communicate is a crucial life skill for all; to increase awareness about the impact communication difficulties have on other people's lives; to highlight the importance of early identification and intervention; and to press for increased provision of speech and language therapy.

appg_groups.name: Spinal Cord Injury
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Spinal Cord Injury
appg_groups.purpose: To address specific issues being faced by Spinal Cord Injured (SCI) people, particularly relating to medical treatment, care and support and developments in treatments, as well as the wider issues that affect the lives of SCI people.

appg_groups.name: Sport
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Sport
appg_groups.purpose: To be the central, constructive, cross-party voice for sport in parliament and to promote the wider societal benefits of sport and physical activity in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Sport and Physical Activity in the Criminal Justice System
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Sport and Physical Activity in the Criminal Justice System
appg_groups.purpose: To be the central, constructive, cross-party voice in parliament that promotes the benefits of sport-based interventions and physical activity as effective tools for the diversion and prevention of crime and the rehabilitation of people involved with the criminal justice system.

appg_groups.name: Sport Modern Slavery and Human Rights
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Sport, Modern Slavery and Human Rights
appg_groups.purpose: To find solutions to pressing human rights problems affecting large-scale sporting events around the world, with a focus on three specific areas: the human rights impacts of the cycle of mega-sporting events, the impacts of the UK Modern Slavery Act on professional sports companies, and discrimination in sport in all its forms.

appg_groups.name: State Pension Inequality for Women
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on State Pension Inequality for Women
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a cross-party forum in which to hold the government to account on the issue of transitional arrangements to compensate 1950's-born women who are affected by changes to the state pension age and to campaign on issues around the state pension age.

appg_groups.name: Steel and Metal Related Industries
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Steel and Metal Related Industries
appg_groups.purpose: To ensure a fair deal for the UK steel and metal related industries by liaising with and lobbying the government, to raise the profile of cultural, environmental and social issues in the industry and its communities, and to research and develop policies which will promote thriving steel and cast metal industries in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Stem Cell Transplantation and Advanced Cellular Therapies
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Stem Cell Transplantation and Advanced Cellular Therapies
appg_groups.purpose: To inform parliamentarians about the use of stem cell transplantation and advanced cellular and gene therapies in saving lives; to facilitate scrutiny of equitable access to and outcomes from stem cell transplantation and advanced cellular and gene therapies; and to promote the expansion of stem cell donation in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Street Children
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Street Children
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the rights of children in street situations worldwide, and the government’s obligations to help ensure their protection. To promote good practice and ensure that children in street situations are on the government’s agenda and are part of the broader national conversation about child rights and protection.

appg_groups.name: Stroke
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Stroke
appg_groups.purpose: To keep stroke high on the parliamentary agenda. The Group aims to be the voice in Parliament of all those affected by stroke, and provides influence, challenge and scrutiny on multiple issues, including stroke rehabilitation, acute care, workforce and research.

appg_groups.name: Students
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Students
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for all parliamentarians to develop greater understanding of the range of issues affecting students in further and higher education. To ensure that student views and experiences are heard in Parliament, facilitate interaction between students and MPs and Peers, and ensure education policy takes account of student views.

appg_groups.name: Suicide and Self-Harm Prevention
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Suicide and Self-Harm Prevention
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness within Parliament and encourage discussion and debate of all issues involved in suicide and self-harm prevention.

appg_groups.name: Surgical Mesh
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Surgical Mesh
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of mesh and the plight of mesh-injured men and women amongst the public, healthcare professionals, welfare assessors and government. To campaign for the recommendations of the First Do No Harm report to be accepted and implemented by government.

appg_groups.name: Surrogacy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Surrogacy
appg_groups.purpose: To fully review our surrogacy laws, encourage and promote debate on the issues, facilitate further research into how surrogacy is conducted, bring the law into line with modern social realities, and encourage domestic surrogacy in the first instance.

appg_groups.name: Sustainable Aviation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Sustainable Aviation
appg_groups.purpose: To promote support and knowledge in parliament of the aviation industry's efforts to achieve sustainability, specifically their goal of net zero carbon emissions by 2050 in line with the government's overall target for the UK.

appg_groups.name: Sustainable Finance
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Sustainable Finance
appg_groups.purpose: To support parliamentarians to understand more about sustainable finance. To bring together policy makers, industry experts, academics and practitioners to build knowledge and political consensus for the changes required in the finance sector to help reach net zero.

appg_groups.name: Sustainable Flood and Drought Management
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Sustainable Flood and Drought Management
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for the discussion and progression of lowland sustainable water level management policies and to improve preparedness in the UK for global warming and its weather extremes.

appg_groups.name: Swimming
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Swimming
appg_groups.purpose: To promote swimming and other aquatic disciplines and to highlight the importance of swimming and water safety in schools.

appg_groups.name: T Levels
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on T Levels
appg_groups.purpose: To increase cross-party parliamentarian awareness and understanding of T Levels; to spread awareness and understanding of T Levels more broadly; and to provide a forum for discussion of the public policy issues around T Levels, involving all the key groups, including employers, young people, the education sector and parliamentarians.

appg_groups.name: Tackling Loneliness and Connected Communities
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Tackling Loneliness and Connected Communities
appg_groups.purpose: To drive forward cross-party work among parliamentarians to influence legislation and policy making in order to reduce loneliness and build on the work of the Jo Cox Commission on Loneliness.

appg_groups.name: Tamils
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Tamils
appg_groups.purpose: To promote in Parliament peace with justice and dignity for Tamils in the Island of Sri Lanka and advance their development so as to recognise their legitimate socio-political aspirations.

appg_groups.name: Taxation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Taxation
appg_groups.purpose: To look at and understand tax policy and taxation on all levels including simplification and digitalisation, EU Brexit and its impact on the UK’s taxation system, and international taxation. To work in partnership with HM Treasury to create a 'safe space' for Parliamentarians and interested stakeholders to meet, discuss and develop innovative proposals to reform, simplify and make the UK’s taxation system fairer.

appg_groups.name: Taxis
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Taxis
appg_groups.purpose: To support and promote the interests of the taxi trade in parliament.

appg_groups.name: Technology and National Security
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Technology and National Security
appg_groups.purpose: New technologies present opportunities to strengthen our national security and vulnerabilities that threaten it. This APPG will improve the narrative and policy debate around technology and national security, bring together leading experts in this field, and build understanding of the technological capabilities needed to protect national interests.

appg_groups.name: Temporary Accommodation
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Temporary Accommodation
appg_groups.purpose: The group will meet to discuss and campaign on issues related to households living in temporary accommodation.

appg_groups.name: Tennis
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Tennis
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the sport of tennis, and to enable MPs and peers to play tennis matches together and compete with outside tennis teams.

appg_groups.name: Textiles and Fashion
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Textiles and Fashion
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the significance of the UK textile and fashion industry across the world, supporting its development as an integral part of our economy.

appg_groups.name: Thalassaemia
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Thalassaemia
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the blood disorder known as thalassaemia and to encourage policy changes that will support patients with this condition.

appg_groups.name: Thalidomide
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Thalidomide
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the interests of people affected by Thalidomide.

appg_groups.name: Theatre
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Theatre
appg_groups.purpose: To support the resilience and relevance of theatre in the UK for audiences, society and the industry. To identify and debate potential opportunities and issues for theatre in the UK. To support parliamentarians' understanding of the theatre and performing arts industry at a national and local level.

benefits_details.source: Society of London Theatre Joint Secretariat 1,501-3,000 14/01/2022 24/01/2022

appg_groups.name: Thrombosis
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Thrombosis
appg_groups.purpose: To promote awareness about the risk and management of venous thromboembolism, also known as thrombosis, deep vein thrombosis, pulmonary embolism and blood clots. To increase understanding of its causes, promote priority research, monitor implementation of recommended practice, increase awareness of long-term impacts, and advocate timely access to diagnosis and treatments.

appg_groups.name: Ticket Abuse
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Ticket Abuse
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and provide a forum for the discussion of issues relating to the sale and resale of tickets, for events, with a particular focus on devising solutions to the problem of ticket touting.

appg_groups.name: the Timber Industries
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Timber Industries
appg_groups.purpose: Our primary purpose is to grow the use of timber in order to help: expand our low-carbon, high-performance offsite manufacturing base for construction; decarbonise the built environment; create safer and higher quality buildings and building supply chains; contribute to growing, sustainably managed forests and biodiverse landscapes.

appg_groups.name: Town Centres
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Town Centres
appg_groups.purpose: To promote parliamentary and public understanding of the importance of high streets, town centres and city centres in order to build environments that are healthy, sustainable and socially inclusive.

appg_groups.name: Trade and Investment
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Trade and Investment
appg_groups.purpose: Working for a comprehensive strategy to global trade and investment; bringing the voice of prospect and prosperity to the heart of the national debate; to encourage an inclusive and sustainable environment and to foster dialogue between parliament with business and associations, unions, consumers, NGOs and civil society.

appg_groups.name: Trade Justice
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Trade Justice
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG will explore how trade has a real-life impact, including how trade interacts with: food standards, farming and animal welfare; the environment and climate change; jobs and workers’ rights; sustainable development in the Global South; human rights and rule of law; digital rights and online harms; public services, health and the NHS.

appg_groups.name: Trade out of Poverty
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Trade out of Poverty
appg_groups.purpose: Organises seminars, inquiries, research and education campaigns to raise awareness in Parliament on removing barriers to trade and using trade as an engine for development in poor countries. The APPG aims to help developing countries achieve inclusive growth and prosperity through trade and investment.

appg_groups.name: Trafficked Britons in Syria
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Trafficked Britons in Syria
appg_groups.purpose: To seek a resolution to the cases of people from the UK who were trafficked by Daesh, and are now detained in North East Syria.

appg_groups.name: Trailer and Towing Safety
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Trailer and Towing Safety
appg_groups.purpose: Brings together parliamentarians, industry representatives and consumer groups to discuss and raise awareness of trailer and towing safety in the UK.

appg_groups.name: Transatlantic Trade
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Transatlantic Trade
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a focus for UK parliamentary cross-party support for a comprehensive transatlantic trade and investment agreement; to contribute to greater public debate and understanding of potential benefits and drawbacks for British consumers, workers and businesses; to strengthen parliamentary and public scrutiny to help secure a successful agreement.

appg_groups.name: Transport Across the North
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Transport Across the North
appg_groups.purpose: To promote discussion and investment in all modes of transport across the North of England and to provide better opportunities for MPs representing Northern constituencies to meet with senior officials and receive briefings from Transport for the North.

appg_groups.name: Transport Safety
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Transport Safety
appg_groups.purpose: To provide opportunities to debate transport safety matters (on road, rail, air

appg_groups.name: the Twelve Steps Recovery Programme from Addiction
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Twelve Steps Recovery Programme from Addiction
appg_groups.purpose: To be a parliamentary source of knowledge and utilisation of the 12 step recovery programme for addictions. To convene meetings, undertake research and create a cross-addiction network.

appg_groups.name: the UK Innovation Corridor
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the UK Innovation Corridor
appg_groups.purpose: To champion the UK Innovation Corridor as one of the most economically productive regions of the country.

appg_groups.name: the UK Shared Prosperity Fund
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the UK Shared Prosperity Fund
appg_groups.purpose: The EU is the largest financial contributor to UK regional development. After Brexit the government will establish a UK Shared Prosperity Fund. The APPG intends to shape thinking and engage in the details of the fund and new system of regional funding and policies after Brexit.

appg_groups.name: the Union
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Union
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the economic, social, cultural and constitutional benefits of the union of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland; To foster good relations between the four countries of the UK and their devolved administrations; and for connected purposes.

appg_groups.name: the United Nations
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the United Nations
appg_groups.purpose: The primary objective of the APPG is to raise awareness of the UN among MPs and Peers; about its contributions across the areas of peace and security, development and human rights; about the scope of international law and its relevance to the UK; and about the applicability of the UN to the British electorate.

appg_groups.name: the United Nations Global Goals for Sustainable Development
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the United Nations Global Goals for Sustainable Development
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the United Nations Global Goals for Sustainable Development and monitor their implementation.

appg_groups.name: United Nations Women
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on United Nations Women
appg_groups.purpose: To drive policy change that seeks to: ‘build back better' for women and girls in the UK post-COVID-19; accelerate progress on gender equality and the SDGs in the UK in the lead up to 2030; create game-changing solutions for women's safety in public spaces across the UK.

appg_groups.name: Universal Credit
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Universal Credit
appg_groups.purpose: To monitor Universal Credit as it is rolled out; to share best practice in supporting constituents; and to make recommendations to government to improve policy.

appg_groups.name: Friends of the University of Hull
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group Friends of the University of Hull
appg_groups.purpose: To promote the University of Hull as a local, national and global centre of teaching, learning and research excellence and a vital contributor to the local community and economy of the Humber region and beyond.

appg_groups.name: Uplands and Hill Farming
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Uplands and Hill Farming
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness and understanding of the issues facing farmers in upland areas and champion hill farmers both inside and outside Parliament. The group will serve as the voice of communities dependent on hill farming throughout the United Kingdom, raising concerns with government ministers, departments and relevant national assemblies.

appg_groups.name: Usher Syndrome
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Usher Syndrome
appg_groups.purpose: To raise issues relating to the challenges faced by those living with Usher Syndrome and their families and for connected purposes.

appg_groups.name: Uyghurs
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Uyghurs
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the persecution against the Uyghur community in Xinjiang, China.

appg_groups.name: Vaccinations for All
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Vaccinations for All
appg_groups.purpose: Raising the political profile of the importance of routine vaccinations, ensuring equitable access to vaccines for everyone, no matter where they live.

appg_groups.name: Valproate and other Anti-Epileptic Drugs in Pregnancy
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Valproate and other Anti-Epileptic Drugs in Pregnancy
appg_groups.purpose: To raise government awareness of the dangers of Valproate and other anti- epileptic drugs in pregnancy and to support and advocate for those harmed by the drugs taken by the mother in pregnancy.

appg_groups.name: Vaping
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Vaping
appg_groups.purpose: To explore the most appropriate parliamentary and regulatory response to e- cigarettes and to raise education and literacy amongst policy makers regarding e-cigarettes and related public policy questions.

appg_groups.name: Vascular and Venous Disease
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Vascular and Venous Disease
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of vascular and venous disease and to encourage actions to promote a greater priority for its prevention and treatment; to encourage research into the causes of vascular and venous disease; to advance excellence and innovation in vascular and venous disease and related cardiovascular conditions.

appg_groups.name: Vegetarianism and Veganism
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Vegetarianism and Veganism
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for discussing issues around vegetarianism and veganism. These include vegan and vegetarian rights and catering, public health, environmental issues and animal rights.

appg_groups.name: Veterans
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Veterans
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a platform within Parliament to promote veterans; to secure support and understanding for the needs of veterans; to scrutinise and hold government, institutions, public sector, business and the third sector, to account to ensure that the UK is the best place in the world to be a veteran.

appg_groups.name: Video Games and Esports
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Video Games and Esports
appg_groups.purpose: To work with the games and interactive entertainment industry, including with its trade body UK Interactive Entertainment, to promote the industry's economic, technological and cultural contributions within Parliament.

appg_groups.name: Visual Arts
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Visual Arts
appg_groups.purpose: The APPG provides a forum for parliamentarians to discuss the role played by the visual arts in the UK. It informs parliamentarians about the latest issues affecting the visual arts community, the contribution the visual arts make to our society and economy and puts forward ideas about how it can remain a vibrant and world-leading sector.

appg_groups.name: Votes at 16
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Votes at 16
appg_groups.purpose: To strengthen the cross-party case for extending the franchise to 16- and 17-year-olds by acting as a discussion forum and active campaigning group for politicians, the youth sector and experts to develop policy and research.

appg_groups.name: Wales in the World
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Wales in the World
appg_groups.purpose: To generate awareness of and to consider the profile of Wales on the international stage, and in doing so to consider themes and ideas to support the development and profile of Wales.

appg_groups.name: War Crimes
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on War Crimes
appg_groups.purpose: To look into matters relating to the presence of alleged Rwandan war criminals in the UK and the prosecution of those who participated in the Rwandan genocide against the Tutsis in 1994.

appg_groups.name: War Heritage
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on War Heritage
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and support the protection, conservation and interpretation of war graves, war memorials and battlefield sites.

appg_groups.name: Water Sanitation and Hygiene
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Water, Sanitation and Hygiene
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness within parliament and government of the impact that a lack of water, sanitation and hygiene has on the lives of people around the world, and the governments obligation to help meet the Sustainable Development Goal on water and sanitation.

appg_groups.name: the Waterways
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Waterways
appg_groups.purpose: To consider matters relating to navigable (and formerly navigable) rivers, canals, estuaries and lakes in the UK, including the potential social, economic and cultural impact of the regeneration of those waterways and extension of the system.

appg_groups.name: Weddings
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Weddings
appg_groups.purpose: To ensure that the issues and challenges that the wedding industry faces are represented by parliamentarians in policy debates, and to promote the wedding industry and its contribution to society.

appg_groups.name: the West Midlands
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the West Midlands
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for cross-party parliamentarians and interested stakeholders from the West Midlands, to monitor policy and maintain a dialogue with government, business, councils and organisations, and to help maximise future investment in the region for the benefit of all its local communities.

appg_groups.name: the Western Gateway
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Western Gateway
appg_groups.purpose: To bring together parliamentarians in support of the Western Gateway, a cross-border economic partnership of local authorities, city regions, Local Enterprise Partnerships and governments covering south Wales and western England.

appg_groups.name: the Western Rail Link to Heathrow
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Western Rail Link to Heathrow
appg_groups.purpose: To support the case for and delivery of the Western Rail Link to Heathrow.

appg_groups.name: Wetlands
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Wetlands
appg_groups.purpose: To build awareness, engagement and support amongst parliamentarians for the policies and partnerships required to restore and create wetlands, as well as ensure they are well managed and protected into the future.

appg_groups.name: Whistleblowing
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Whistleblowing
appg_groups.purpose: Whistleblowers are a vital element of a transparent society. In 1998 the Public Interest Disclosure Act was introduced to protect employees who speak out. In the face of many recent scandals the APPG is looking at the effectiveness of this legislation and how it might be improved.

appg_groups.name: White Ribbon UK
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on White Ribbon UK
appg_groups.purpose: To engage parliamentarians (particularly male parliamentarians) in raising awareness and challenging male violence against women and girls in all forms.

appg_groups.name: Wilton Park
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Wilton Park
appg_groups.purpose: For parliamentarians to learn more about and better understand and support Wilton Park, offering advice and encouragement in both its everyday and long-term work.

appg_groups.name: Wine and Spirits
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Wine and Spirits
appg_groups.purpose: To promote and inform on the economic and commercial benefits of the UK wine and spirit trade; to inform and stimulate debate on issues of relevance to the trade and to consumers, including English wine and British spirits; and to introduce parliamentarians to members of the trade from their constituencies.

appg_groups.name: Wine of Great Britain
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Wine of Great Britain
appg_groups.purpose: To identify how Whitehall departments, in conjunction with Members of the Commons and Lords, can support producers of wine from grapes grown across the UK, to ensure that relevant legislation and regulations, combined with innovative support and trade deals can deliver a profitable sector for the domestic and export markets.

appg_groups.name: Women and Work
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Women and Work
appg_groups.purpose: To promote discussion around women and work.

appg_groups.name: Women in Parliament
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Women in Parliament
appg_groups.purpose: Brings together MPs and peers to discuss and campaign for increasing the number of women in parliament in all parties and, to support women in parliament and those standing for public office.

appg_groups.name: Women in the Penal System
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Women in the Penal System
appg_groups.purpose: To increase the knowledge and awareness of issues around women in the penal system as well as push for the full implementation of the Corston Report recommendations.

appg_groups.name: Women in Transport
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Women in Transport
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum to discuss and overcome the under-representation of women in transport by promoting best practice examples of employers leading the way in gender diversifying their workforce.

appg_groups.name: Women Peace and Security
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Women, Peace and Security
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for the discussion and analysis of issues relating to the Women, Peace and Security agenda. To bring together parliamentarians, policymakers, academia and civil society to scrutinise and strengthen the UK government's implementation of commitments to women and girls' rights in fragile and conflict-affected states.

appg_groups.name: Womens Football
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Women's Football
appg_groups.purpose: To promote women's football.

appg_groups.name: Womens Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Women's Health
appg_groups.purpose: To empower women to ensure that they can make an informed choice about the best treatment for them and that they are treated with dignity and respect.

appg_groups.name: the Wood Panel Industry
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for the Wood Panel Industry
appg_groups.purpose: To highlight the vital contribution that wood panel manufacturers make to the regional and national economies within the UK and to ensure growth for

appg_groups.name: Woods and Trees
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Woods and Trees
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of the UK's woods and trees and to discuss the steps necessary to protect, restore and expand them in a time of climate and nature crises.

appg_groups.name: Working at Height
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Working at Height
appg_groups.purpose: Falls from height and falling objects from height account for the highest number of preventable fatalities and injuries across all sectors in UK industry. The APPG will seek to understand the root causes and propose effective, sensible measures to reduce this toll and send people safely home from work.

appg_groups.name: Wrestling
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Wrestling
appg_groups.purpose: To promote, support, and raise awareness of professional wrestling; to work with the industry to improve it and to build confidence; to celebrate British success in professional wrestling.

appg_groups.name: the Yazidis
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on the Yazidis
appg_groups.purpose: To raise the issue of the Daesh genocide against the Yazidis and ensure comprehensive responses, including justice for the victims and survivors, assistance with their needs, and ensure non-repetition of the atrocities in the future.

appg_groups.name: Yoga in Society
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Yoga in Society
appg_groups.purpose: To support wellbeing across the UK by disseminating the benefits of yoga through a biomedical lens. The APPG is focused on designing constructive ways to integrate yoga into schools, healthcare, occupational health, and criminal justice, and within Parliament by endeavouring to offer free classes to all who work there.

appg_groups.name: Yorkshire and Northern Lincolnshire
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group for Yorkshire and Northern Lincolnshire
appg_groups.purpose: To bring MPs of all parties together with key leaders - those in local government, the private sector and social enterprise - to help maximise future investment in the region for the benefit of all local communities and economies.

appg_groups.name: Young Peoples Health
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Young People's Health
appg_groups.purpose: To raise awareness of issues related to the mental, social and physical health of young people.

appg_groups.name: Youth Action against Climate Change
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Youth Action against Climate Change
appg_groups.purpose: To provide a forum for young people to engage with parliamentarians on issues related to climate change; to promote horizontal inclusion of young people concerned with the issue related to climate change; to raise the profile of climate change issues affecting constituencies across UK; to encourage behavioural change on local and global levels; to inform interactions among parliamentarians, youth, NGOs, and experts.

appg_groups.name: Youth Affairs
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Youth Affairs
appg_groups.purpose: To raise the profile of issues which affect and concern young people; to encourage dialogue between parliamentarians, young people and youth services; and to encourage a co-ordinated and coherent approach to policy making on youth affairs.

benefits_details.source: YMCA England and Wales Joint Secretariat 1,501-3,000 29/01/2021 01/06/2021

appg_groups.name: Youth Employment
appg_groups.title: All-Party Parliamentary Group on Youth Employment
appg_groups.purpose: To promote youth employment in all its forms and the role of young people within the economy; to ensure that young people's voices are heard; to highlight the need for quality opportunities; and to share best practice.
